verses.verse: A Psalm of David <S%H1732><s%>. The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is my light <S%H216><s%> and my salvation <S%H3468><s%>; whom shall I fear <S%H3372><s%>? the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is the strength <S%H4581><s%> of my life <S%H2416><s%>; of whom shall I be afraid <S%H6342><s%>?

When the wicked <S%H7489><s%>, even mine enemies <S%H6862><s%> and my foes <S%H341><s%>, came <S%H7126><s%> upon me to eat up <S%H398><s%> my flesh <S%H1320><s%>, they stumbled <S%H3782><s%> and fell <S%H5307><s%>. came: Heb. approached against me

Though an host <S%H4264><s%> should encamp <S%H2583><s%> against me, my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall not fear <S%H3372><s%>: though war <S%H4421><s%> should rise <S%H6965><s%> against me, in this will I be confident <S%H982><s%>.

One <S%H259><s%> thing have I desired <S%H7592><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, that will I seek <S%H1245><s%> after; that I may dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of my life <S%H2416><s%>, to behold <S%H2372><s%> the beauty <S%H5278><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and to enquire <S%H1239><s%> in his temple <S%H1964><s%>. the beauty: or, the delight

For in the time <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H7451><s%> he shall hide <S%H6845><s%> me in his pavilion <S%H5520><s%>: in the secret <S%H5643><s%> of his tabernacle <S%H168><s%> shall he hide <S%H5641><s%> me; he shall set me up <S%H7311><s%> upon a rock <S%H6697><s%>.

And now shall mine head <S%H7218><s%> be lifted up <S%H7311><s%> above mine enemies <S%H341><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%> me: therefore will I offer <S%H2076><s%> in his tabernacle <S%H168><s%> sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of joy <S%H8643><s%>; I will sing <S%H7891><s%>, yea, I will sing praises <S%H2167><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>. joy: Heb. shouting
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, when I cry <S%H7121><s%> with my voice <S%H6963><s%>: have mercy <S%H2603><s%> also upon me, and answer <S%H6030><s%> me.

When thou saidst, Seek <S%H1245><s%> ye my face <S%H6440><s%>; my heart <S%H3820><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto thee, Thy face <S%H6440><s%>, LORD <S%H3068><s%>, will I seek <S%H1245><s%>. When: or, My heart said unto thee, Let my face seek thy face, etc

Hide <S%H5641><s%> not thy face <S%H6440><s%> far from me; put <S%H5186><s%> not thy servant <S%H5650><s%> away <S%H5186><s%> in anger <S%H639><s%>: thou hast been my help <S%H5833><s%>; leave <S%H5203><s%> me not, neither forsake <S%H5800><s%> me, O God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation <S%H3468><s%>.
When my father <S%H1><s%> and my mother <S%H517><s%> forsake <S%H5800><s%> me, then the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will take me up <S%H622><s%>. take: Heb. gather me

Teach <S%H3384><s%> me thy way <S%H1870><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and lead <S%H5148><s%> me in a plain <S%H4334><s%> path <S%H734><s%>, because of mine enemies <S%H8324><s%>. a plain: Heb. a way of plainness mine: Heb. those which observe me

Deliver <S%H5414><s%> me not over unto the will <S%H5315><s%> of mine enemies <S%H6862><s%>: for false <S%H8267><s%> witnesses <S%H5707><s%> are risen up <S%H6965><s%> against me, and such as breathe out <S%H3307><s%> cruelty <S%H2555><s%>.
I had fainted, unless <S%H3884><s%> I had believed <S%H539><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the goodness <S%H2898><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%>.
Wait <S%H6960><s%> on the LORD <S%H3068><s%>: be of good courage <S%H2388><s%>, and he shall strengthen <S%H553><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%>: wait <S%H6960><s%>, I say, on the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
